I just finished this for the first time.  My feelings are that Half Life 1 is for fanboys and people who have some academic interest in the progression of shooters, and Half Life 2 actually has a lot to offer regardless of how long it's been since it's been released.

The good:
-GRAVITY GUN!
-I had a lot of fun on the sections where I had to figure out how to get my vehicle through an area.
-Missions manage to have a lot of variance from one to the other.  More than any game I've ever seen.

The bad:
-Some awful platforming
-Friendly NPCs are idiots
-I felt the levels were weirdly paced.  3 or 4 vehicle chapters in a row and then I never climb into another vehicle again?
-Enemies show no reaction to getting shot.  I find this a rather massive oversight for a shooter.  
-There's some walking robot enemies that take SEVEN rockets to take down and at one point you have to take down like 4 in a row.  That's just tedious!  They also don't show enough reaction to taking damage.  I honestly thought they were just indestructible after hitting them with 5 rockets that didn't do anything more than stun them for a second.

That about sums it up.  I'll get around to HL2E1 and E2 eventually.  (Sidenote, who named those things...)
Buena historia, le faltaron putas.

To be fair, you have to have a very high IQ to understand Half Life 2. The humour is extremely subtle, and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the jokes will go over a typical viewerâ€™s head. Thereâ€™s also Gordonâ€™s nihilistic outlook, which is deftly woven into his characterisation- his personal philosophy draws heavily from Narodnaya Volya literature, for instance. The fans understand this stuff; they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of these jokes, to realise that theyâ€™re not just funny- they say something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike Half Life 2 truly ARE idiots- of course they wouldnâ€™t appreciate, for instance, the humour in Gordonâ€™s existential catchphrase "Crowbarâ€ which itself is a cryptic reference to Turgenevâ€™s Russian epic Fathers and Sons. Iâ€™m smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Gabinâ€™s genius wit unfolds itself on their television screens. What fools.. how I pity them. ğŸ˜‚

And yes, by the way, i DO have a Half Life 2 tattoo. And no, you cannot see it. Itâ€™s for the ladiesâ€™ eyes only- and even then they have to demonstrate that theyâ€™re within 5 IQ points of my own (preferably lower) beforehand. Nothin personnel kid ğŸ˜

Half-Life is by far one of my most favorite FPS games. I love the story. I love the mechanics. It is a fantastic and epic journey. Half-Life 2 continues the sage with a better engine, better weapons and more vehicles. Try it out. It's amazing.
